8.1 Without prejudice to any term and condition under this Agreement, the Company shall maintain in force, at all times during the Term and [*****], at its own costs and expenses, with insurers of internationally recognized reputation reasonably acceptable to the Repairer, insurances in accordance with industry standards with respect to the undertakings of the Company in Clause 15 ("Liability and Indemnity") of this Agreement including:
     (i) Aircraft Hull and Spares All Risks Insurances (including, to the extent usually available war and allied perils); and,

  (ii) Comprehensive General Third Party Legal Liability and Aircraft Passengers and Third Party Legal Liability Insurance in respect of incidents involving Aircraft to the extent usually available, having a Combined Single Limit of not less than [*****] any one occurrence; and,
     (iii) Employer's liability insurance; and,
     (iv) Repairer's values to be insured, including:
     - Lease of Stock (Exhibit 8 Clause 2.2) and Advanced Pool Service (Exhibit 15): the Items of the Stock shall be insured by theCompany under Spares All Risk Insurance for not less than the full replacement value; and,

- Main Elements Service (Exhibit 11): each Spare Main Element to be delivered by the Repairer to the Company shall be insured by the Company, for not less than its full replacement value, under the Hull Insurance when installed on the Aircraft in addition to the agreed value of such Aircraft and under the Spares All Risk Insurance while in Stock prior to attachment or following removal and replacement from the Aircraft, including transportation to and from the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 Without prejudice to any term and condition under this Agreement, the Company shall use commercially reasonable efforts to maintain insurance coverage during the Term.  The Company should obtain, if commercially reasonable, Aircraft Hull and Spares All Risks Insurances. The Company should also attempt to obtain General Third Party Legal Liability and Aircraft Passengers and Third Party Legal Liability Insurance in respect of incidents involving Aircraft.  Employer's liability insurance should also be considered.  Regarding Repairer's values to be insured, the Company should consider insurance for: Lease of Stock (Exhibit 8 Clause 2.2) and Advanced Pool Service (Exhibit 15) and Main Elements Service (Exhibit 11).
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation significantly weakens the insurance requirements for the Company (AZUL), shifting from a mandatory obligation to a 'best efforts' approach. Removing the requirement for specific insurance types like 'Comprehensive General Third Party Legal Liability' and a 'Combined Single Limit of not less than [*****]' creates a legal risk because Brazilian aviation regulations (if applicable to this agreement) and standard international aviation practices typically mandate minimum liability coverage for aircraft operators.  The 'best efforts' clause is too vague and does not provide sufficient protection to the Repairer (ATR) in case of an incident.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Brazilian Civil Aviation Regulations (if applicable), International Aviation Practices regarding liability insurance, New York General Obligations Law relating to contractual good faith.

perturbation.original_text: 8.4 In respect of all of the above insurances to contain breach or warranty provisions and confirmation the policies shall not be cancelled or materially changed without [*****] prior written notice [*****] or such lesser period in respect of War and Allied Peril).
perturbation.changed_text: 8.4 The Company shall use reasonable efforts to inform Repairer of material changes to insurance policies.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the mandatory notice period ([*****] prior written notice) for cancellation or material changes to the insurance policies. This creates a significant legal risk for the Repairer because it removes a crucial safeguard that allows them to ensure continuous coverage, which is essential for protecting their interests and complying with their own regulatory obligations. The new text only requires 'reasonable efforts' to inform, a much weaker obligation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Brazilian Civil Aviation Regulations (if applicable), New York General Obligations Law relating to contractual good faith, Standard International Insurance practices.

perturbation.original_text:
8.6 At the latest upon the Signing Date, the Company shall provide the Repairer with relevant insurance certificates, in English, evidencing insurance requirements of this Clause 8, in a form reasonably acceptable to the Repairer, to be attached to this Agreement in the Exhibit 17 ("Insurance certificates").

Upon each renewal of the relevant insurance policies, the Company shall on reasonable request provide the Repairer with relevant insurance certificates in order to evidence insurance is maintained in accordance with this Clause 8. The Company also agrees to promptly pay each premium in respect of the aforesaid insurances and in the event of its failure to take out or maintain any such insurance then, without prejudice to any other rights it may have in respect of such failure, the Repairer may do so in its place and recover the cost of doing so from the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.6 The Company shall provide insurance information to the Repairer. The Company agrees to pay insurance premiums.  In the event of failure to maintain coverage, the Repairer may explore options.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the explicit requirement for the Company to provide relevant insurance certificates to the Repairer both at the signing date and upon renewal. The vagueness of 'provide insurance information' weakens the obligation. Removing 'in English' could further complicate verification. The shift from a clear obligation to 'explore options' for the Repairer if the Company fails to maintain insurance significantly reduces the Repairer's legal recourse and increases their risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Brazilian Civil Aviation Regulations (if applicable), New York General Obligations Law relating to contractual good faith, Standard International Insurance practices.
